item.title: 韩国实习医生周二集体离职，将他们对政府医疗政策的抗议升级，引发医院取消手术和其他治疗。
item.description:
South Korean trainee doctors collectively walked off their jobs Tuesday to escalate their protest of a government medical policy, triggering cancellations of surgeries and other medical treatments at hospitals.
trib.al/Uz2RvlB

item.title: 据联邦官员称，一名 83 岁的老人因 20 世纪 80 年代的一连串银行抢劫案而被监禁了三十多年，如今他又身陷囹圄。
item.description: An 83-year-old man imprisoned for more than three decades for a string of 1980s bank robberies is back behind bars, according to federal officials. trib.al/a100SKq

item.title: 医学专家对黑人糖尿病截肢患者日益增多敲响了警钟。
item.description: Medical experts sound the alarm on growing diabetic amputations among Black patients. trib.al/P4rlirO

item.title: 在确定底特律前警探莫伊塞斯-希门尼斯（Moises Jimenez）在对安萨里的审判中隐瞒了可能牵连到其他枪手的证据后，39 岁的安萨里被免罪。
item.description:
Ansari, 39, was exonerated after it determined that Moises Jimenez, a former Detroit police detective withheld evidence for Ansari’s trial that would have implicated someone else as the shooter.
trib.al/EZBiYkz

item.title: 印第安纳州的一位母亲说，她的第二个孩子被诊断出患有先天性心脏缺陷，并在新生儿重症监护室住了近两个月，这给了她转行的灵感。
item.description: An Indiana mother says she was inspired to change careers after her second child was diagnosed with congenital heart defects and spent nearly two months in a neonatal intensive care unit. trib.al/567Aqno

item.title: 由于报告方式的改变，2022 年美国莱姆病病例数增加了近 70%。
item.description: Lyme disease case counts in the US rose by almost 70% in 2022 due to a change in how it's reported. trib.al/R0nU3g2

item.title: 前总统特朗普首次就俄罗斯反对派领袖阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的死发表直接评论，抱怨他声称自己在法律诉讼中面临的政治迫害。
item.description: Former Pres. Trump used his first direct comment on Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny's death to complain about the alleged political persecution he claims he's facing in his own legal battles. trib.al/VyGIPJU

item.title:
Capital One 将以 350 亿美元收购 Discover，将美国最大的两家信用卡公司合并。
更多信息
item.description:
Capital One to buy Discover for $35 billion in deal that combines two of nation's largest credit card companies.

Read more: trib.al/2TJxpMR

item.title:
马萨诸塞州警方称，在马萨诸塞州韦尔斯利，一名司机显然是踩了油门而不是刹车，结果被两辆停在路边的汽车夹在中间。
当局说，这名司机受了轻伤，被送进了医院。
item.description:
Police in Massachusetts said a driver apparently hit the gas instead of the brakes and ended up sandwiched between two parked cars in Wellesley, Massachusetts.

The driver was hospitalized with minor injuries, authorities said. abcn.ws/3OxZqtm

item.title: Capital One 将以 350 亿美元收购 Discover，将美国最大的两家信用卡公司合并。
item.description: Capital One to buy Discover for $35 billion in deal that combines two of nation's largest credit card companies. trib.al/JbUmsmA

item.title:
阿根廷洛斯冰川国家公园的一名游客捕捉到了一块巨大的冰块从佩里托莫雷诺冰川破裂并掉入阿根廷湖的瞬间。
据联合国教科文组织称，不断移动的大冰川前端会定期将冰山压入湖中。
item.description:
A visitor to Argentina's Los Glaciares National Park captured the moment a huge chunk of ice broke from the Perito Moreno Glacier and fell into Lake Argentino.

According to UNESCO, the front of the large, constantly moving glacier, regularly calves icebergs into the lake.

item.title: 天文学家发现了可能是宇宙中最亮的天体--一颗类星体，它的中心有一个黑洞，黑洞的生长速度非常快，每天吞下的黑洞相当于一个太阳。
item.description: Astronomers have discovered what may be the brightest object in the universe — a quasar with a black hole at its heart growing so fast that it swallows the equivalent of a sun a day. trib.al/7AOjtTs

item.title: 科罗拉多斯普林斯一所大学校园内发生两起凶杀案，一名学生因涉嫌此案于周一被拘留。
item.description: A student was taken into custody Monday in connection with a double homicide on a university campus in Colorado Springs, officials say. trib.al/nIMvGoh

item.title: 据纽约联邦检察官称，一名密歇根州妇女涉嫌从服装租赁公司盗走价值 80 多万美元的名牌服装和配饰，然后在网上出售。
item.description: A Michigan woman allegedly stole more than $800,000 worth of designer clothing and accessories from apparel rental companies that she then sold online, according to federal prosecutors in New York. trib.al/CBdFOhb

item.title: 据官方称，去年在死亡谷国家公园再次出现的一个古老湖泊将比最初预计的时间更长，因为南加州已经下了几轮特大暴雨。
item.description: An ancient lake that reemerged at Death Valley National Park last year will stick around for longer than initially expected now that several rounds of extreme rain have poured through Southern California, according to officials. trib.al/usoZnzN

item.title: 当局称，在对无人机向西弗吉尼亚州一所联邦监狱运送毒品的指控进行调查后，11 名嫌疑人已被逮捕。
item.description: Eleven suspects have been arrested following an investigation into drugs allegedly delivered by drones into a federal prison in West Virginia, authorities say. trib.al/3BGgA4z

item.title: 为庆祝总统日，一面 60 x 90 英尺的美国国旗--世界上最大的自由飘扬的美国国旗--于周一清晨在乔治-华盛顿大桥上展开。
item.description: A 60 x 90 foot flag — the world's largest free-flying American flag — was unfurled on the George Washington Bridge early Monday morning in honor of Presidents Day. abcn.ws/3OxZqtm

item.title: 马萨诸塞州的一些地方官员要求州长莫拉-希利（Maura Healey）派遣国民警卫队制止暴力事件，并解决波士顿南部一所高中的安全问题。
item.description: Some local officials in Massachusetts are asking Gov. Maura Healey to send in the National Guard to stop violence and address security concerns at a high school south of Boston. trib.al/ZE2b4bA

item.title: 梵蒂冈的秘密守护者即将退休。他想告诉你的是
item.description: The keeper of the Vatican’s secrets is retiring. Here’s what he wants you to know: trib.al/iGeWBNw

item.title: 五角大楼称，胡塞武装自开始在红海和亚丁湾发动袭击以来首次动用了一艘无人驾驶潜艇，随后美国对胡塞武装控制的也门地区的五个目标进行了所谓的自卫打击。
item.description: The U.S. conducted what it called self-defense strikes on five targets in the Houthi-controlled area of Yemen after the Houthis employed an unmanned submarine for the first time since attacks in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden began, the Pentagon said. trib.al/KYsqBGm

item.title: 在众议院议长迈克-约翰逊（Mike Johnson）否决了参议院通过的国家安全补充提案后，一个由两党议员组成的众议院小组于上周末公布了一项新的对外援助和边境提案。
item.description: After Speaker Mike Johnson rejected the Senate-passed national security supplemental, a bipartisan group of House lawmakers unveiled a new foreign aid and border proposal late last week. trib.al/86dECWw

item.title:
R转@ABC"它从路边跳下来，紧紧抓住她......她的朋友们得以脱身，把这东西打跑了"
这次遭遇发生在华盛顿州法尔城附近，60 岁的骑手因伤势严重住院。
item.description:
“It jumped from the side of the road and latched onto her ... her friends were able to detach and fight this thing off."

The encounter happened near Fall City, Washington, and left the 60-year-old rider hospitalized with serious injuries.

item.title:
多年来，梵蒂冈一直试图揭穿其秘密档案是如此秘密的说法。
但某种神话和神秘的光环一直存在--直到现在。
item.description:
The Vatican has been trying for years to debunk the idea that its secret archives are all that secret.

But a certain aura of myth and mystery has persisted — until now. trib.al/3LA8aWv

item.title:
据当局称，在西雅图郊区的一条小路上，一群骑自行车的人击退了袭击一名同伴的美洲狮，挽救了她的生命。
更多信息请点击此处：
item.description:
A group of cyclists saved a fellow rider's life by fighting off a cougar that attacked her on a suburban Seattle trail, according to authorities.

More here: abcnews.go.com/US/cyclists-f…

item.title: 在以色列与哈马斯的持续战争中，加沙第二大医院的病人正在撤离，该医院一直受到以色列国防军部队的攻击。
item.description: Patients are being evacuated from Gaza's second-largest hospital, which has been under attack from Israel Defense Forces troops, amid the ongoing Israel-Hamas war. trib.al/qUEVKri

item.title:
美国前总统特朗普周六在费城进行了一次不同寻常的竞选活动，他在 "Sneaker Con"（运动鞋大会）上推广新品牌运动鞋。
阅读更多
item.description:
Former Pres. Trump made an unusual campaign stop in Philadelphia Saturday, promoting new branded sneakers at “Sneaker Con,” a gathering that bills itself as the “The Greatest Sneaker Show on Earth.”

Read more: abcnews.go.com/Politics/trum…

item.title: 拜登总统为自己的政绩和胜任公职的能力进行了有力的辩护--但如果他退出竞选或因健康危机而无法参选，民主党人将如何挑选提名人：
item.description: Pres. Biden has forcefully defended his record and fitness for office — but if he were to, hypothetically, withdraw from the race or find himself unable to run due to a health-related crisis, here's how Democrats would pick a nominee: trib.al/Qe5kGvC

item.title:
在纽约一名法官对他漫长的欺诈案审判处以 3.55 亿美元罚款（他计划对此提出上诉）后的第二天，前总统特朗普在宾夕法尼亚州和密歇根州这两个战场上度过了他的周六。
第一站：费城的 Sneaker Con。
item.description:
The day after a New York judge fined him $355 million in the wake of a lengthy fraud trial, which he plans to appeal, former Pres. Trump spent his Saturday in two battleground states, Pennsylvania and Michigan.

First stop: Sneaker Con in Philadelphia. trib.al/yPUBffr

item.title: R to @ABC：据联邦官员称，这次是因为他自 6 月 27 日以来在芝加哥郊区参与了至少七起银行抢劫案。
item.description: This time, it's for his involvement in at least seven bank robberies in the Chicago suburbs since June 27, according to federal officials.

item.title: 据联邦官员称，一名 83 岁的老人因 20 世纪 80 年代的一连串银行抢劫案而被监禁了三十多年，如今他又身陷囹圄。
item.description: An 83-year-old man imprisoned for more than three decades for a string of 1980s bank robberies is back behind bars, according to federal officials. trib.al/fKlLEw3
